pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:0.4.eng: The subchapter on sunshades and sandals

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:0.5.eng: The training rule on not wearing a chest wrap

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī asaṅkaccikā gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.2.eng: a nun had gone to the village for alms without wearing her chest wrap.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.3.eng: While she was walking along a street, a whirlwind lifted up her upper robes.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.6.pli: Sā bhikkhunī tehi manussehi uppaṇḍiyamānā maṅku ahosi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.6.eng: Because she was teased by those people, she felt humiliated.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.7.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī upassayaṃ gantvā bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.7.eng: After returning to the nuns’ dwelling place, she told the nuns what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.8.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.8.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.9.eng: “How could a nun enter an inhabited area without wearing her chest wrap?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī asaṅkaccikā gāmaṃ pāvisī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.13.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī asaṅkaccikā gāmaṃ pavisissati.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.15.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.16.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī asaṅkaccikā gāmaṃ paviseyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a nun enters an inhabited area without wearing her chest wrap, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.16.1.comm: I translate in accordance with the findings of Oskar von Hinüber and Bhikkhu Anālayo in their paper “The Robes of a Bhikkhunī”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.1.8.eng: it is for the purpose of concealing the body below the collar bone and above the navel.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.1.10.pli: parikkhittassa gāmassa parikkhepaṃ atikkāmentiyā āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.1.10.eng: if she crosses the boundary of an enclosed inhabited area, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.1.11.pli: Aparikkhittassa gāmassa upacāraṃ okkamantiyā āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.1.11.eng: If she enters the vicinity of an unenclosed inhabited area, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.2.comm: Sp 4.1227: Acchinnacīvarikāyātiādīsu saṅkaccikacīvarameva cīvaranti veditabbaṁ, “Her robe is stolen, etc.: just the robe which is the chest cover is to be understood.” The “etc.”, ādisu, refers to the following non-offense, “If her robe is lost”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.9.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.10.eng: The thirteenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.11.eng: The ninth subchapter on sunshades and sandals is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.12.0.comm: At this point come the remaining seventy pācittiya rules that the nuns have in common with the monks. By Dhammikavagga and Nandasikkhāpada the Pali text indicates the last chapter and the last rule of the pācittiyas. In summary these seventy rules are as follows. Bi Pc 97–116 are equivalent to Bu Pc 1–20. Then Bi Pc 117–118 = Bu Pc 31–32; Bi Pc 119 = Bu Pc 34; Bi Pc 120–121 = Bu Pc 37–38; Bi Pc 122 = Bu Pc 40; Bi Pc 123–144 = Bu Pc 42–63; Bi Pc 145 = Bu Pc 66; Bi Pc 146–160 = Bu Pc 68–82; Bi Pc 161 = Bu Pc 84; Bi Pc 162–164 = Bu Pc 86–88; Bi Pc 165 = Bu Pc 90; and Bi Pc 166 = Bu Pc 92.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.14.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho, ayyāyo, chasaṭṭhisatā pācittiyā dhammā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.14.eng: “Venerables, the one hundred and sixty-six rules on confession have been recited.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.15.eng: In regard to this I ask you,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.21.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.22.eng: The section on minor rules has been completed.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.23.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession in the Nuns’ Analysis is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:0.4.eng: The training rule on asking for ghee

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:0.5.pli: Ime kho panāyyāyo aṭṭha pāṭidesanīyā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:0.5.eng: Venerables, these eight rules on acknowledgment come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo sappiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.2.eng: the nuns from the group of six were eating ghee that they had asked for.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.4.eng: “How can nuns eat ghee that they have asked for?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.5.pli: Kassa sampannaṃ na manāpaṃ, kassa sāduṃ na ruccatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.5.eng: Who doesn’t like nice food? Who doesn’t prefer tasty food?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.6.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.6.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.7.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.7.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo sappiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.8.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six eat ghee that they have asked for?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā, bhikkhuniyo sappiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo sappiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjissanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.12.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.14.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.15.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī sappiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, paṭidesetabbaṃ tāya bhikkhuniyā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.15.1.eng: ‘If a nun asks for ghee and then eats it, she must acknowledge it:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.16.pli: ‘gārayhaṃ, ayye, dhammaṃ āpajjiṃ asappāyaṃ pāṭidesanīyaṃ, taṃ paṭidesemī’”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.16.eng: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.17.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.1.17.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo gilānā honti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards a number of nuns were sick.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.2.eng: The nuns who were looking after them asked,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.3.eng: “I hope you’re bearing up? I hope you’re getting better?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.4.pli: “Pubbe mayaṃ, ayye, sappiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjāma, tena no phāsu hoti;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.4.eng: “Previously we ate ghee that we had asked for, and then we were comfortable.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.5.pli: idāni pana ‘bhagavatā paṭikkhittan’ti kukkuccāyantā na viññāpema, tena no na phāsu hotī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.5.eng: But now that the Buddha has prohibited this, we don’t ask because we’re afraid of wrongdoing. And because of that we’re not comfortable.” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.6.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.7.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānāya bhikkhuniyā sappiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjituṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.7.eng: “Monks, I allow a sick nun to eat ghee that she has asked for.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.8.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.8.eng: And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.9.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī agilānā sappiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, paṭidesetabbaṃ tāya bhikkhuniyā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.9.1.eng: ‘If a nun who is not sick asks for ghee and then eats it, she must acknowledge it:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.10.pli: ‘gārayhaṃ, ayye, dhammaṃ āpajjiṃ asappāyaṃ pāṭidesanīyaṃ taṃ paṭidesemī’”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:1.2.10.eng: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1.8.pli: yassā vinā sappinā na phāsu hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1.8.eng: who is not comfortable without ghee.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1.10.pli: gosappi vā ajikāsappi vā mahiṃsasappi vā. Yesaṃ maṃsaṃ kappati tesaṃ sappi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1.10.eng: ghee from cows, ghee from goats, ghee from buffaloes, or ghee from whatever animal whose meat is allowable.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1.11.pli: Agilānā attano atthāya viññāpeti, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1.11.eng: If she is not sick and she asks for herself, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1.12.eng: When she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.1.13.eng: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.2.1.pli: Agilānā agilānasaññā sappiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjati, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.2.1.eng: If she is not sick, and she does not perceive herself as sick, and she eats ghee that she has asked for, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.2.2.pli: Agilānā vematikā sappiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjati, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.2.2.eng: If she is not sick, but she is unsure of it, and she eats ghee that she has asked for, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.2.3.pli: Agilānā gilānasaññā sappiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjati, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.2.3.eng: If she is not sick, but she perceives herself as sick, and she eats ghee that she has asked for, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.2.4.eng: If she is sick, but she does not perceive herself as sick, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.2.5.eng: If she is sick, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.2.6.eng: If she is sick, and she perceives herself as sick, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.3.3.eng: if she asked for it when she was sick, but eats it when she is no longer sick;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.3.4.eng: if she eats the leftovers from one who is sick;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.3.6.eng: if it is from those who have given an invitation;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.3.7.eng: if it is for the benefit of someone else;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.3.8.eng: if it is by means of her own property;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.3.10.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd1:2.3.11.eng: The first training rule on acknowledgment is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:0.4.eng: The training rules on asking for oil … honey … syrup … fish … meat … milk … curd

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo telaṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.2.eng: the nuns from the group of six were eating oil that they had asked for.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.3.eng: … were eating honey that they had asked for.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.4.eng: … were eating syrup that they had asked for.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.5.eng: … were eating fish that they had asked for.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.6.eng: … were eating meat that they had asked for.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.7.eng: … were drinking milk that they had asked for.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.8.eng: … were eating curd that they had asked for.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.10.eng: “How can nuns eat curd that they have asked for?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.11.pli: Kassa sampannaṃ na manāpaṃ, kassa sāduṃ na ruccatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.11.eng: Who doesn’t like nice food? Who doesn’t prefer tasty food?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.12.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.12.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.13.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā … pe … tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.13.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.14.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjissantī”ti … pe …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.14.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six eat curd that they have asked for?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.15.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.15.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.18.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjissanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.18.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.19.pli: Netaṃ, bhikkhave, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya … pe …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.20.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.20.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.21.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, paṭidesetabbaṃ tāya bhikkhuniyā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.21.1.eng: ‘If a nun asks for curd and then eats it, she must acknowledge it:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.22.pli: ‘gārayhaṃ, ayye, dhammaṃ āpajjiṃ asappāyaṃ pāṭidesanīyaṃ, taṃ paṭidesemī’”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.22.eng: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.23.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.1.23.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo gilānā honti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards a number of nuns were sick.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.2.eng: The nuns who were looking after them asked,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.3.eng: “I hope you’re bearing up? I hope you’re getting better?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.4.pli: “Pubbe mayaṃ, ayye, dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjimhā, tena no phāsu hoti;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.4.eng: “Previously we ate curd that we had asked for, and then we were comfortable.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.5.pli: idāni pana ‘bhagavatā paṭikkhittan’ti kukkuccāyantā na viññāpema, tena no na phāsu hotī”ti … pe …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.5.eng: But now that the Buddha has prohibited this, we don’t ask because we’re afraid of wrongdoing. And because of that we’re not comfortable.” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.6.eng: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.7.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānāya bhikkhuniyā dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjituṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.7.eng: “Monks, I allow a sick nun to eat curd that she has asked for.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.8.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.8.eng: And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd2:1.2.9.1.eng: ‘If a nun who is not sick asks for (oil …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:1.1.1.pli: dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, paṭidesetabbaṃ tāya bhikkhuniyā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:1.1.1.eng: curd and then eats it, she must acknowledge it:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:1.1.2.pli: ‘gārayhaṃ, ayye, dhammaṃ āpajjiṃ asappāyaṃ pāṭidesanīyaṃ, taṃ paṭidesemī’”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:1.1.2.eng: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.4.pli: … pe … ayaṃ imasmiṃ atthe adhippetā bhikkhunīti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.8.pli: yassā vinā dadhinā na phāsu hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.8.eng: who is not comfortable without curd.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.10.eng: sesame oil, mustard seed oil, honey tree oil, castor oil, oil from tallow.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.16.eng: what lives in water is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.18.eng: the meat of those animals whose meat is allowable.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.20.pli: gokhīraṃ vā ajikākhīraṃ vā mahiṃsakhīraṃ vā yesaṃ maṃsaṃ kappati tesaṃ khīraṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.20.eng: milk from cows, milk from goats, milk from buffaloes, or milk from whatever animal whose meat is allowable.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.23.pli: Agilānā attano atthāya viññāpeti, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.23.eng: If she is not sick and she asks for herself, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.24.eng: When she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.1.25.eng: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.2.1.pli: Agilānā agilānasaññā dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjati, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.2.1.eng: If she is not sick, and she does not perceive herself as sick, and she eats curd that she has asked for, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.2.2.pli: Agilānā vematikā dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjati, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.2.2.eng: If she is not sick, but she is unsure of it, and she eats curd that she has asked for, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.2.3.pli: Agilānā gilānasaññā dadhiṃ viññāpetvā bhuñjati, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.2.3.eng: If she is not sick, but she perceives herself as sick, and she eats curd that she has asked for, she commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.2.4.eng: If she is sick, but she does not perceive herself as sick, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.2.5.eng: If she is sick, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.2.6.eng: If she is sick, and she perceives herself as sick, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.3.eng: if she asked for it when she was sick, but eats it when she is no longer sick;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.4.eng: if she eats the leftovers from one who is sick;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.6.eng: if it is from those who have given an invitation;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.7.eng: if it is for the benefit of someone else;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.8.eng: if it is by means of her own property;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.10.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.11.eng: The eighth training rule entailing acknowledgment is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.12.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho, ayyāyo, aṭṭha pāṭidesanīyā dhammā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.12.eng: “Venerables, the eight rules on acknowledgment have been recited.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.13.eng: In regard to this I ask you,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.19.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pd8:2.3.20.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment in the Nuns’ Analysis is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj1-4:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj1-4:0.4.eng: Rules shared in common with monks

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj1-4:1.1.eng: The pārājika rules 1–4 for nuns are not found in any manuscript. Tradition says they are similar to the corresponding rules for monks.
